channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Ministers set out plan to train and keep more NHS staff
item.description: The government says measures including shorter medical degrees will help plug gaps in the workforce.

item.title: Covid pandemic linked to surge in child and teen diabetes
item.description: Experts have seen a 'substantial' yet unexplained rise in new cases worldwide since the pandemic.

item.title: Moldova attack: Two dead as man opens fire inside Chisinau airport
item.description: The man was denied entry to Chisinau airport and then shot two officials, authorities say.

item.title: Hacking trial: Prince Harry claims £320,000 in damages for 33 articles
item.description: The Duke of Sussex alleges articles published by Mirror Group Newspapers breached his privacy.

item.title: Sue Gray cleared to work for Labour amid Conservative anger
item.description: The ex-official can start from September, but ministers say she may have broken civil service rules.

item.title: UK porn age checks raise privacy concerns
item.description: Digital rights groups say more robust age verification requirements lack transparency.

item.title: Sky Mobile and Giffgaff customers suffer outage
item.description: The networks both confirm users reporting problems with their mobile phone connection.

item.title: Zac Goldsmith: Rishi Sunak wrong to say I refused to apologise
item.description: Tory peer hits back at the prime minister in a war of words over his decision to quit as a minster.

item.title: Lucy Letby trial: Babies died 'due to care failures and not murder'
item.description: Murder-accused nurse Lucy Letby's barrister says there is "no direct evidence" she harmed anybody.

item.title: Essex school toilet sex assaults sees boy arrested
item.description: Police are investigating reports of serious sexual assaults in a gender neutral toilet at a school.

item.title: Cancer patient regains ability to smile after innovative surgery
item.description: Daniel Kilty suffered with facial paralysis before undergoing the innovative operation in Portsmouth.

item.title: Anita Anand: Presenter interviews Canadian minister with same name
item.description: The BBC presenter and Canadian politician joke about all the times they have been mistaken for each other.

item.title: Camp spotted on suspected Wagner site in Belarus
item.description: A detailed satellite image taken for the BBC shows hundreds of new tent-like structures at Belarus military base

item.title: What Titan sub wreckage can tell us about the tragedy
item.description: How debris recovered from the sea bed near the Titanic could help investigators learn what happened.

item.title: How did Annie’s body end up on a Scottish beach?
item.description: Annie Börjesson's body was found in 2005. Police found no evidence of criminality but loved ones always had questions.

item.title: Seen by millions - an untrue TikTok post featuring this man
item.description: The firm is struggling to stop climate misinformation spreading on its platform, BBC investigation finds.

item.title: Milky Way: Icy observatory reveals 'ghost particles'
item.description: An extraordinary image of ghost particles in the Milky Way is captured by an observatory buried at the South Pole.

item.title: Quiz of the week: Who missed the Rocketman's final mission?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

item.title: Aspartame - is it a possible cause of cancer?
item.description: Reports suggest the World Health Organization could label the sweetener as possibly carcinogenic.

item.title: Over-30s eye Australia gap year as age limit upped
item.description: Australia extends the age limit to 35 for Brits who want to live and work down under.

item.title: How this man helped prevent a revenge murder
item.description: Millions of dollars are going into community violence prevention. Will it work?

item.title: Alan Arkin: Little Miss Sunshine actor dies aged 89
item.description: Arkin won an Oscar for playing the outrageous grandad in the 2006 film, and also appeared in Argo.

item.title: London Super Sewer gets underground flower garden
item.description: The artificial oasis 50m beneath London aims to reflect a healthier future for the River Thames once the new sewer opens.

item.title: Naomi Campbell becomes a mother for a second time, aged 53
item.description: The supermodel, who welcomed her first child two years ago, says "it's never too late".

item.title: Nutmeg co-founder Nick Hungerford sets up charity for bereaved children
item.description: Nick Hungerford's charity for bereaved children, Elizabeth's Smile, is named after his daughter.

item.title: Thailand: Rescuers amputate leg of woman stuck in travelator
item.description: Her family says they are shocked and saddened at the incident in Thailand's Don Mueang airport.

item.title: The Ashes 2023: England hopes fading after Australia dominate at Lord's
item.description: England's hopes in the second Test and the Ashes hang by a thread after an awful third day against Australia at Lord's.

item.title: Austrian Grand Prix 2023: Max Verstappen on pole ahead of Charles Leclerc
item.description: Max Verstappen fends off a challenge from Ferrari's Charles Leclerc to take pole position at the Austrian Grand Prix.

item.title: Ashes: England v Australia - second Test, day three highlights
item.description: England's hopes in the second Test and the Ashes hang by a thread following an awful third day against Australia at Lord's.

item.title: The Ashes 2023: Nathan Lyon a doubt for rest of series with 'significant calf strain'
item.description: Australia spinner Nathan Lyon suffered a "significant calf strain" on day two of the second Ashes Test and is a doubt for the rest of the series.

item.title: England captain Heather Knight gives ICEC report insight amid 'ironing' remark
item.description: England captain Heather Knight says cricket has made progress from the days she received sexist remarks about ironing but has "a long way to go" in the wake of a damning independent report.

item.title: France shooting: Macron accuses rioters of exploiting teen killed by police
item.description: At a crisis meeting, France's president condemns three nights of riots as "unjustifiable".

item.title: France shooting: How a teenager's death sparked riots
item.description: The death of 17-year-old Nahel M, during a traffic stop, has provoked anger across the country.

item.title: France riots: Why are police using guns during traffic stops?
item.description: Nahel M's death follows an increase in police using firearms on drivers who fail to stop.

item.title: France shooting: Policeman charged over teen's traffic stop death
item.description: France sees a third night of mass unrest, triggered by Tuesday's police shooting of a teenager.

item.title: France shooting: Who was Nahel M, shot by French police in Nanterre?
item.description: He was learning to be an electrician and played rugby league but died at a police check near Paris.

item.title: What we know about the killing... in 55 seconds
item.description: The BBC's Hugh Schofield investigates at the scene where police shot dead 17-year-old Nahel.

item.title: Mother of teenage boy speaks after Paris police shooting
item.description: Seventeen-year-old Nahel M was shot by police during a traffic stop in Nanterre, a suburb of Paris.

item.title: Macron's solidarity seems to fall on deaf ears among locals
item.description: Some residents of Nanterre are bracing for a long cold war between French suburbs and the state.
